accussed_details.name: Muhammad Yaqoob
allegation: Abduction of Mst. Sughran Bibi alias Mst. Arshan

complaint_summary: Muhammad Yaqoob was accused of abducting Mst. Sughran Bibi alias Mst. Arshan. A case was registered at Police Station Sadar Bahawalpur.
investigation_summary: The abductee was produced in court and sent for medical examination to determine her age. The petitioner failed to appear in court on subsequent dates and did not produce the abductee again.
judgment_summary: The court found that the learned Sessions Judge failed to issue a show-cause notice under Section 514(1) of the Cr. P. C. before ordering the forfeiture of bonds. The revision petitions were accepted, and the forfeiture order was set aside.
Decision_or_verdict: The forfeiture order dated July 26, 1967, was set aside. The Sessions Judge was directed to proceed according to law.
legal_arguments: Failure to issue show-cause notice under Section 514(1) of the Cr. P. C.
Requirements of law for bond forfeiture not satisfied.
statutes: Section 514(1) of the Cr. P. C.
witnesses: Mst. Sughran Bibi alias Mst. Arshan

witness_statement.Mst. Sughran Bibi alias Mst. Arshan: Produced in court and sent for medical examination to determine her age.

key_issues: Non-compliance with Section 514(1) of the Cr. P. C.

legal_terms.Bond Forfeiture: Legal process where a bond is declared forfeited due to non-compliance with its terms.
legal_terms.Show-Cause Notice: A legal notice requiring a party to explain or justify an action or decision.

words_and_phrases.Machalka: A type of bond or security in legal proceedings.

summary_vector_notes: Muhammad Yaqoob's revision petition was accepted due to procedural lapses in bond forfeiture under Section 514(1) of the Cr. P. C. The Sessions Judge's order was set aside, and directions were issued to proceed according to law.
